turns.text: Okay Do you have you ever had to put your children in child care Mary Dell
turns.label: o

turns.text: Oh yes Im an old experienced hand I started back when it wasnt stylish to do that at all My daughter thats seventeen now --
turns.label: ny

turns.text: -- I worked even when she was baby
And I had private care for both my daughters until they were two and then I was really lucky to have put them in Methodist day school at Preston Hollow Methodist right off --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And it was wonderful environment I I just wish all kids if they have to be put in day school could have that kind of place
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Well I have uh nine year old and six year old and neither one of them has ever been in --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- in uh day care for the reason of of me working --
-- but uh they both went through preschool
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And uh weve just been real lucky --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Its not hard to find anything thats part-time So many of the churches have really strong --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Right like half day programs uh-huh
turns.label: aa

turns.text: -- but it was nightmare back when Cheryl was little and this is one of the few churches that did it There were couple downtown Dallas but they were so seemed cold and impersonal I just couldnt hack it
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And what I liked about Preston Hollow is that the people that were there when Cheryl was two which was fifteen years ago many of them are still there today So there --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- was real continuity She went back as teenager and these people that had changed her diapers when she was three were still there
So it it was really neat But it was because they had director that had always done it as labor of love and --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: -- she just kept good people and --
-- real cheerful place lots of arts and crafts and Im really glad my kids had it because Plano schools do so little of that
That if they hadnt had it before they hit first grade they were never going to have any art or music or any of the interpretive stuff
uh-huh Yeah that is uh big drawback I think in that in the uh public schools out here
turns.label: aa

turns.text: You know to youre lucky to have an art teacher and if you do you get them once week or something you know
Or pay for it after school Our Emilys in the third grade over at Huffman and they started pilot program where we can pay private tuition so that they can take French and music and art and --
Oh is that right I had no idea
turns.label: bh

turns.text: -- you know I willingly did it but I thought this makes me angry This is something that ought to be in the schools --
-- rather than some of the other stuff they do
And with our budget cuts Im sure --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: -- thats not going to not going to change anytime soon
Well thats the only way theyre Yeah well thats the only way theyre going to be able to do it And parents who really want their kids to have any humanities are going to have to do that
turns.label: sv

turns.text: So in some ways I think the the day schools do serve those purposes
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Yeah Thats true Well even the preschools you know they get so much of that in preschool and then when they hit kindergarten you know its like wham
turns.label: aa

turns.text: Yeah yeah Get the computers out --
turns.label: aa

turns.text: Its so difficult for them Um did you have your children did you say in home in in private care was that in your home or in someone elses home
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Until they were two Yeah Yeah both times they were at our house
turns.label: sd

turns.text: uh-huh So you were able to have somebody come there
turns.label: b

turns.text: And that was hard too I I lucked out with really good people both times but I know so many people that are never able to find that and Id practically give my paycheck away to do it so -
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah Yeah Did you have nanny or did you have someone --
turns.label: b

turns.text: Well no she didnt live with us Uh the first one was an elderly lady who was putting daughter through nursing school --
turns.label: nn

turns.text: And she kept Cheryl during the day and then did more baby-sitting at night
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And she was neat because she was like the grandmother that my kids never had --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- because both our parents are dead
So that that was plus from --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- that respect as well And then with Emily it was neighborhood friend --
I just cannot fathom putting little bitty baby in commercial care center
turns.label: sv

turns.text: uh-huh I was just listening to program this morning oh well I guess it was on the HOME SHOW but they were talking about uh new uh - oh I cant even think of the name of it I was halfway listening while I was painting
turns.label: b

turns.text: Um its some kind of advisory board theyve put together for parents and children --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- and theyve now moved it to Washington and the the doctor that was on there the pediatrician said you know I cant imagine leaving three week old and taking them to nursery day-care --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Well they give lot more leave I work at now and our benefits for maternal and and parental care and even for elderly people --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: -- are are really expanding We have more options now then we did when I my kids were born with being able to take off full-time longer --
-- of you can phase your schedule in so that its not full-time for --
-- up to six months Its really neat Ive Ive had couple of assistants that came back just three days week or theyve you know whatever schedule they want from pay standpoint
We try to work it with their hours And that helps because you dont have to just wean yourself cold turkey and say --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- okay I never get to see my baby for eight hours day again
And the bank has lot of programs now for child care referrals Ive - of course its too late for me so --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- Ive Ive not tried them to see how effective they are but --
-- I think were finally beginning to make progress but just not very fast
And for our age group its too late too little too late
turns.label: sd

turns.text: But I I do think its an area that needs to be looked at and improved because more of us are going to have to work
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Two income families I think are here to stay
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Well and I would think you know since big business is supposedly why the government makes the decisions they do --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: -- you know the the people that work in big business have families --
So its only to their advantage that they get these programs going and --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: You retain employees and keep them longer Thats that was the rationale they gave when they were giving us information about our --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: -- they want us to be happy and want us to be able to cope with trying to --
-- split ourselves in fifteen million pieces
So I I hope it helps It seems to help the new mothers --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- not have to come back full-time because thats hard
Thats good to know I have couple of friends that have have found the uh you know pri- private home to take their children to when theyre young --
turns.label: ba

turns.text: -- until they hit the preschool age
And they - usually you know youll find woman thats keeping like six children or --
-- four to six children in the home and my future future sister-in-laws mother does that too full-time
Well in Plano though the problem is you find - and this is what I found with Emily I from the time she started first grade I wanted her out in Plano area
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And I kept finding neighbors and friends and theyd move
turns.label: sd

turns.text: She ended up being in different home every year
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And I finally decided I didnt like that because it was traumatic to her to get so attached to family and then have them move
turns.label: sd

turns.text: So this year I I tried Kinder-Care and then shes old enough to -
turns.label: sd
